intro: Sagenia difformis, commonly known as the irregular sage, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lamiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant features square stems and opposite leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive shape. Its flowers are typically purple or blue, arranged in whorls along the stems, and it produces small, four-lobed fruits. Sagenia difformis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
